2 minutes away
Approaching the village of Inhulets.
Another Su-34 is flying from Crimea towards Kherson Oblast. It may fly to Zaporizhzhia Oblast, following two earlier aircraft.
Approaching the village of Inhulets.
Explosions were heard. 4 KABs impacted the area.
Another Su-34 is flying from Crimea towards Kherson Oblast. It may fly to Zaporizhzhia Oblast, following two earlier aircraft.
The 3rd plane is circling in the Crimea-Kherson border area. It will escort the two Su-34s back to their home base, which are already on the return flight, flying southeast over Kherson Oblast.

Watch out guys, Astraia Intel knows more about how the war is going than the literal president of Ukraine. I think if Zelensky (someone who has constantly lied about this war) is sounding the alarm bells, it's a solid sign that things haven't been going in Ukraine's favour.

"They will accept military rule because I say so"

Yesterday, the battle for the Serebryanskyi Forest in Luhansk Oblast finally ended after the remaining Ukrainian forces were pushed out of its southwestern-most part.
This battle began in late 2022 during the Ukrainian Kharkiv counteroffensive and lasted for nearly three years. Ukrainian forces, including Azov, held their positions in a massive complex of trenches and bunkers within the now largely destroyed forest. 
However, the vast majority of Russian advances during this nearly 3-year-long battle occurred in the final month. I have overlayed what the frontline roughly looked like on August 6, around the beginning of the Russian offensive here. 
As a result, Ukrainian control in Luhansk Oblast has now shrunk to roughly 47 km¬≤.
Russian Su-34s carried out launch maneuvers of KAB glide-bombs towards Tokarivka, Kherson Oblast.
Russian Su-34s carried out launch maneuvers of KAB glide-bombs towards Tokarivka, Kherson Oblast.
~90 seconds until impacts
~90 seconds until impacts
Approaching
Approaching
Explosions in Tokarivka
The KABs impacted the village of Inhulets. The same area that was hit yesterday. The Su-34s are now returning back to Crimea.

Russian forces have captured the village of Olhivske, Hulyaipole Direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~55.
Total land area: ~0.34 km¬≤.

Update from the Gaza Strip - Gaza Governorate:
With the IDF officially announcing the beginning of its offensive to capture Gaza City, intensified operations have been recorded in two main parts of the city over the past 48 hours.
In the southwest, Israeli forces resumed clearing operations in the already flattened parts of southern Gaza City. They quickly reached Dahdouh Road from the southeast and are now within 1.15 km of the coast. Israeli forces have now taken up positions in a residential quarter (31.50155, 34.42969) in the first part of the partially destroyed coastal Sheikh Ijlin Neighbourhood. 
To the northeast, the IDF continued pushing from Jabalia at their usual pace and entered into the Gaza Governorate in the area of the Al Sheik Radwan Pool. They began clearing operations towards Gaza City centre from this area, capturing several dense residential blocks (31.52189, 34.4701 & 31.5241, 34.47019), before armoured units began their main vector of attack northwest down Kamal Naser Street. Here they advanced for close to 500 metres, reaching Al-Jala Street, where they expanded for about 240 metres through the dense residential blocks to the southwest (31.52593, 34.46655). 
+ ~1.80 km¬≤ in favour of the IDF.

Update from the Gaza Strip - Northern Governorate:
Following the announcement by the IDF that they would be beginning their offensive on Gaza City, a series of supporting attacks were launched on the Northern Governorate to support formations advancing in Gaza Governorate. 
Israeli armoured units began advancing along the coastal Al-Rashid Road, as well as along roads previously created by the IDF during their previous operations here, reaching the first districts of Jabalia City. They were able to quickly clear and capture the outlying streets (31.5529, 34.4642), reaching the edge of the Madinat Al 'Awada Neighbourhood from the north (31.54792, 34.46454). At the same time, other forces captured other key points along the way, including the destroyed Gaza Oil Company complex (31.55287, 34.46791), and the former IDF base at the Gaza Desalination Plant (31.56156, 34.46763). 
To the southeast, Israeli forces massively intensified their operations in the Nazla Neighbourhood of Jabalia City and cleared a large section of the dense residential zones north of Al-Quds Street, reaching the edge of the Sheik Radwan Neighbourhood of Gaza City (31.53159, 34.47553). 
The goal here appears to be to isolate remaining Palestinian militant cells in Jabalia Refugee Camp, Jabalia City, Beit Lahiya, and Atatra, so the IDF can focus on establishing a stronger presence in the northern suburbs of Gaza City. 
+ ~2.28 km¬≤ in favour of the IDF.

Meanwhile, after what seems like forever...
There haven't been any charges yet, but it will be interesting to see how this plays out.

Sentinel satellite imagery reveals that groups of Ukrainian soldiers were encircled in the western part of Sichneve around four days ago, after Russian forces bypassed the village and continued advancing further west. 
Russian forces are now striking them with FPV drones, while ground forces are attempting to clear the pocket by attacking from the east of the village. A large grey zone has formed in the treelines west of the settlement, so it's possible that Ukraine will make attempts at rescuing these soldiers through this. 
However, as a result of the local collapse of Ukrainian lines in this area and the subsequent encirclement of Ukrainian troops, Ukrainian Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi dismissed Maksym Kituhin, the commander of the 20th Army Corps, from his current position. He will still serve in the AFU, but in another unspecified role.
Ballistic missile launch from Yemen to Israel
Ballistic missile launch from Yemen to Israel
The missile launch failed, and it fell along the way.
Footage showing a Russian Mi-28 helicopter flying over Bakhmut. The city is beginning to become overgrown now that fighting is moving away.

Russian Army Widens Control In Kupyansk, Advances Near Siversk (Videos)
The Russian military advanced by early September 17 in several directions in the Kharkiv region, including within the city of Kupyansk, as well as in the direction of Siversk in the neighboring region of Donetsk.
Russian troops advanced further in Kupyansk. The troops captured most of the city‚Äôs northern part, appalling multiple Ukrainian counter attacks. However, Kiev forces are reported to have entrenched themselves in high-rise buildings in the center of the city, where heavy fighting is taking place.
Meanwhile, in the direction of Siversk, the Russian military made gains in several areas. The troops secured vast parts of the Serebryansky forest. Another push was reported from the western outskirts of Hryhorivka in the southern direction.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Repels Ukrainian Attacks In Sumy, Destroys First Austrian Abrams (Videos)
The Russian military has repelled two more Ukrainian counterattacks in the Sumy direction, inflicting heavy losses on Kiev forces.
According to reports from September 17, the counterattacks were repelled near Alekseevka and Sadky.
Interestingly, a video from the recent battles in Sumy shows a Russian FPV suicide drone hitting what appears to be one of the American-made M1A1 AIM v.1 Abrams main battle tanks supplied recently by Australia.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Syria On September 17, 2025 (Map Update)

Kiev Forces Are Losing Ground In Pokrovsk (Videos)
As of September 17, Kiev forces continue to lose ground to the Russian military in several directions in Donetsk, Dnepropetrovsk and Zaporozhye.
A new push by the Russian military was reported to the east of Shakhovo, which is located in the Pokrovsk direction.
The main battle in this direction remains, however, in Pokrovsk itself, with Russian troops pushing deeper into urban areas in the city.
Read more 
HERE

Gaza Death Toll Exceeds 65,000 On Second Day Of Major Israeli Offensive (18+ Videos)
More strikes hit Gaza City and other parts of the Palestinian Strip on September 17, as Israeli troops advanced in a major offensive meant to defeat Hamas.
The Israeli Air Force and Artillery Corps have struck over 150 targets in Gaza City since the start of the offensive a day earlier, the Israeli Defense Forces said in a statement, noting in another that the targets included tunnels, buildings used by ‚Äúterror groups,‚Äù cells of operatives, and other infrastructure.
Al-Jazeera said that recent Israeli strikes on the Strip claimed the lives of 62 Palestinians, with at least 40 getting killed in Gaza City.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Forces Continue Strikes Against Ukrainian Armed Forces‚Äô Transport and Energy Hubs 
The overall ratio of attacking Russian and Ukrainian fixed-wing UAVs last night favored Russia: 13 Ukrainian UAVs (+6 during the day) were shot down over Russia, while 136 out of 172 launched UAVs were shot down over Ukraine.
